title: Holtville man dead after single-vehicle collision in Brawley
content: BRAWLEY — A 44-year-old Holtville man died in a single-vehicle collision that occurred Saturday morning just east of Keystone and Casey roads, California Highway Patrol announced.    Gerardo Garcia succumbed to fatal injuries sustained in the collision and was the only reported occupant in the vehicle.    At about 5 a.m. Saturday, Garcia was driving his 2003 Nissan eastbound on Keystone, east of Casey, at an unknown speed.    Garcia reportedly allowed his vehicle to move into the opposing lane of traffic. He then attempted to steer his Nissan back to the right side of the road, and caused the vehicle to overturn and land in the drainage ditch on its roof.    A CHP news release stated Garcia was wearing a seat belt at the time of the incident. It is believed DUI did not play a factor in the collision.
